question: Tinnitus! Please help!?
question_content:
Last night, just when I was about to fall asleep, my right ear started this really loud, high-pitched ringing all of a sudden which kept me up all night. I found a website for white noise, put my headphones on and fell asleep right away. 3hrs later I woke up, and it was silent. But it started again 10 minutes after that, and now it's not going anywhere. 

I can only hear it in my right ear, and it's very very loud... Does this mean it will not go away?? Please help me!

answers.answer_content:
I think you need to find out what is causing the tinnitus first... Loud noise could certainly cause it. You could have a blockage or infection.  Also when not related to an ear problem, tinnitus is caused by hypoglycemia, or jaw or neck problems,  most often a result of a circulation problems around the ear... with a direct link to a diet rich in sugars, refined foods and unhealthy fats from meat and lacking in fibre rich, wholesome foods. As you see there are quite a few reasons or causes of tinnitus and there are more.  Changes in blood pressure, toxins and medications also cause tinnitus.  Until you know the cause you can't treat it properly.  
A three-day fruit and vegetable juice fast can clear the ear of clogging mucus.  
Ginko biloba ( a herbal remedy ) helps promote circulation.
Garlic juice lowers blood pressure and dilates tiny blood vessels.

I guess no one will be able to tell you whether it will go away or not. it won't hurt though to check in time what you can do about it IF it doesn't go anywhere.
